channel.title: David Uhden Collado's Blog
channel.description: Latest articles and updates from David Uhden Collado's blog.

item.title: OpenBSD: A Robust and Secure Operating System for the Future
item.description: Since its inception, OpenBSD has stood out as a UNIX-like operating system based on 4.4BSD, known for its security as well as its minimalist design. This article explores its philosophy of security and simplicity, key security innovations, and the dedicated community behind it.

item.title: The GPL: A Tool with Paradoxes in the World of Free Software
item.description: This article analyzes the contradictions and side effects of the GPL, exploring how its restrictions can limit cooperation and freedom in the free software community.

item.title: Rethinking the UNIX Philosophy: Beyond the Simplicity of Small Programs
item.description: The UNIX philosophy promotes building systems from small, specialized tools. This article delves into the essence of the UNIX philosophy, common misunderstandings in the age of microservices, and how its principles can be applied beyond the operating system.

item.title: Reinventing Operating Systems: Lessons from OpenBSD and Beyond
item.description: This article examines the evolution of operating systems, contrasting the enterprise paradigm with the philosophies of OpenBSD and Apple. It discusses the impact of backward compatibility on innovation and security, and explores the potential for a more flexible balance in the future of computing.
